intro: Corydalis meifolia var. violacea, commonly known as the violet-flowered corydalis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland or shaded areas, preferring moist, well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight hairy texture. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a striking visual element to its natural habitat.
